intro: Tetradenia kedahensis, commonly known as the Kedah tetradenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
